subject: RE: [junit] assertNotEquals and assertThrows
msgSnippet: ... I don t agree with that conclusion. I think it communicates better. And I m in fact not sure that it s more verbose than try/catch. Cheers, Ilja
messageBody:
> Ilja Preuss wrote:
> > > assertThrows is hard
> > > in a language like Java that doesn't have literal code blocks,
> >
> > Well, not really hard - just quite verbose (using anonymous inner
> > classes).
>
> Right, and therefore not preferable to try/catch.

I don't agree with that conclusion. I think it communicates better. And I'm
in fact not sure that it's more verbose than try/catch.

Cheers, Ilja
